org.epochx.op.selection
Class TournamentSelector

java.lang.Object
  org.epochx.op.ConfigOperator<Model>
      org.epochx.op.selection.TournamentSelector
All Implemented Interfaces:
ConfigListener, Listener, Operator, PoolSelector, ProgramSelector
public class TournamentSelector
extends ConfigOperator<Model>
implements ProgramSelector, PoolSelector

Tournament selection chooses programs through a tournament performed on a subset of the population. In tournament selection, x programs are randomly selected from the population to enter a 'tournament'. The program with the best fitness in the tournament then becomes the selected program. The tournament size, x, is given as an argument to the constructor.

If a model is provided then the following parameters are loaded upon every configure event:

  • random number generator

If the getModel method returns null then no model is set and whatever static parameters have been set as parameters to the constructor or using the standard accessor methods will be used. If any compulsory parameters remain unset when the selector is requested to select programs, then an IllegalStateException will be thrown.

See Also:
FitnessProportionateSelector, RandomSelector, LinearRankSelector

getPool

public java.util.List<CandidateProgram> getPool(java.util.List<CandidateProgram> pop,
                                                int poolSize)
Constructs a pool of programs from the population, choosing each one with the program selection element of TournamentSelector. The size of the pool created will be equal to the poolSize argument. The generated pool may contain duplicate programs, and as such the pool size may be greater than the population size.

Specified by:
getPool in interface PoolSelector
Parameters:
pop - the population of CandidatePrograms from which the programs in the pool should be chosen. Must not be null, nor empty.
poolSize - the number of programs that should be selected from the population to form the pool. Must be 1 or greater.
Returns:
the pool of candidate programs selected using tournament selection.

getRNG

public RandomNumberGenerator getRNG()
Returns the random number generator that this selector is using or null if none has been set.

Returns:
the rng the currently set random number generator.

setRNG

public void setRNG(RandomNumberGenerator rng)
Sets the random number generator to use. If a model has been set then this parameter will be overwritten with the random number generator from that model on the next configure event.

Parameters:
rng - the random number generator to set.

setModel

public void setModel(Model model)
Sets a model that will provide the configuration for this operator. The necessary parameters will be obtained from the model the next time, and each time a configure event is triggered. Note that until a configure event is fired this operator may be in an unusable state. Any previously set parameters will stay active until they are overwritten at the next configure event.

If a model is already set, it may be cleared by calling this method with null.

Overrides:
setModel in class ConfigOperator<Model>
Parameters:
model - the model to set or null to clear any current model.
